keyword: how many calories in a deviled egg
title: How Many Calories in a Deviled Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a deviled egg, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and simple recipe tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Deviled Egg?
assumptions: Standard recipe: half hard-boiled large egg filled with yolk mixed with 1 tsp mayonnaise, mustard, salt, pepper; no extras like paprika or relish.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, egg size, mayo brand, and added ingredients. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A single deviled egg typically contains about 75 kcal with around 3 g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Use low-fat mayonnaise instead of regular

faqs.q: How many calories in a deviled egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 75 kcal for one standard deviled egg.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in a deviled egg?
faqs.a: About 3 g protein per deviled egg, mainly from the egg itself.

faqs.q: Are deviled eggs high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 6.5 g fat per egg, mostly from the yolk and mayonnaise.

faqs.q: How does the recipe affect calories in a deviled egg?
faqs.a: More mayo or add-ins like relish or bacon can increase calories by 5-20 kcal each.
Very low, about 0.5 g carbs per egg, with no fiber.
